ElementDescription: Since you started in our research study, please indicate what best describes your average involvement in support groups, such as Alcoholics Anonymous and Narcotics Anonymous?
Notes: 0= None; 1= Less than Once a Month; 2= Once a Month; 3= Every Other Week; 4= Once a Week; 5= Twice a Week; 6= Mora than twice a week

ElementDescription: Since you started in our research study, please indicate what best describes your average involvement in group therapy.
Notes: 0= None; 1= Less than Once a Month; 2= Once a Month; 3= Every Other Week; 4= Once a Week; 5= Twice a Week; 6= Mora than twice a week; 7= New to Mental Health Treatment

Notes: 1= Mental Health; 2= Substance Abuse; 3= Both Mental Health and Substance Abuse

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, added a new medication or increased the dose of an existing medication; 2= Yes, discontinued a medication or decreased the dose of an existing medication

ElementDescription: Compared to another person of your age, would you say your health is:
Notes: 1= Worse than others; 2= Same as others; 3= Better than others; 998= Do Not Know; 999= No Answer

ElementDescription: How often in the past one month were you unable to do the work you usually do because of an emotional or psychological problem?
How often in the past one month did you have to lie in bed for more than half a day because because of an emotional or psychological problem?

Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= A Little; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Extremely; 998= Do Not Know; 999= No Answer

ElementDescription: Treatment arm

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Alcohol Use Disorder (drinking that was excessive, caused problems such as health issues or emotional difficulties, or interfered with relationships or other activities)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Substance Use Disorder (substance use that was excessive, caused problems such as health issues or emotional difficulties, or interfered with relationships or other activities)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Substance Use Disorder (substance use that was excessive, caused problems such as health issues or emotional difficulties, or interfered with relationships or other activities). If Yes, specify most problematic drug(s):
Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (problems with inattention, hyperactivity, and/or impulsivity that started before age 12)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Conduct Disorder (significant behavior problems involving aggression and/or breaking rules, such as engaging in physical fights, bullying or threatening others, using weapons, physical cruelty to animals or people, intentional property destruction, breaking and entering, shoplifting, running away overnight, frequently skipping school)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Eating Disorder (anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge-eating disorder; trying to keep from gaining weight or restricting food intake, fear of gaining weight, eating binges)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (excessive worry about multiple things that is hard to control and is accompanied by symptoms including irritability, difficulty concentrating, muscle tension, trouble sleeping, restlessness, fatigue)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Autism Spectrum Disorder (problems with social communication and social interaction as well as restricted, repetitive interests, behavior, or activities; may have been diagnosed with Asperger Syndrome)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Learning Disorder (such as dyslexia or significant difficulties with math, reading, or writing; having an individualized education plan (IEP) or being in a special class to help with learning difficulties)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (Intrusive, distressing memories of the event, dreams about the event, flashbacks to the event, avoidance of reminders of the event, reenacting the event, trouble remembering parts of the event, guilt about the event, being jumpy or ''on alert,'' trouble sleeping)?
Who is the Mental Health History Questionnaire being administered to?
Notes: 1=Participant (>= 18 years old); 2=Legally authorized representative (participant < 18 years old);

ElementDescription: Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Agoraphobia (very afraid/avoidance of situations such as open spaces, closed spaces, crowds, being in line, being away from home alone; fear/avoidance must be due to concern about having panic or other symptoms and having difficulty escaping or getting help)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Separation Anxiety (overly afraid or anxious about being away from home or a caregiver, losing a caregiver, or something bad happening to a caregiver, refusing to go to school or other places because they don't want to be separated, getting really upset or feeling sick because of separation from a caregiver)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Social Anxiety Disorder (excessive anxiety/avoidance related to social interactions due to concern about being judged by others; examples include public speaking, eating, performing)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Specific Phobia (excessive fear/avoidance of snakes, bugs, spiders, animals, heights, flying, storms, the dark, blood or needles; very bothered by this fear or interferes with activities)

Have/has you/your child been diagnosed with or treated for: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (bad thoughts or pictures that come into your/their mind and are hard to get rid of, behaviors that you/they have to do over and over to decrease anxiety or keep something bad from happening)
